availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William Durrett (Trigg County, Kentucky, commission merchant)

body.p: Trigg County, Kentucky, commission merchant. Virginia native. Father of Mary M. Durrett Hawks, Louisa A. Durrett, Morgan M. Durrett, Nancy M. Durrett, and William L. Durrett. Merchant in Trigg County, Kentucky, in 1840. Commission merchant in Trigg County in 1850. Owned two enslaved persons in Trigg County in 1850. Commission merchant in Trigg County in 1860. Owned one enslaved person in Trigg County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Sixth Manuscript Census of the United States (1840), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, p. 302.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, District 2, p. 362A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, District 2, p. 283.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, p. 73-74.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, p. 379B.
